item.title: Alethic modality
item.description: A type of modality that concerns what is necessary and what is possible.

item.title: Classical logic
item.description: In classical logic, the law of the excluded middle obtains. When this is removed, one obtains Intuitionistic logic. External resources SEP

item.title: Doxastic modality
item.description: A type of modality that concerns obligation and permission.

item.title: Law of the excluded middle
item.description: In propositional logic, the law of the excluded middle is formulated as an inference rule: =—= $A \lor \neg A$

item.title: Modality
item.description: According to the Kant-Sellars thesis, the distinctive expressive job of modal vocabulary is to articulate the inferential connections among descriptive concepts in virtue of which they have the content that they do.

item.title: Nonmonotonic logic
item.description: Monotonicity is a property of the entailment relation of a logic. External resources SEP
